Definition: Tardive dyskinesia is a movement disorder caused by long-term use of certain medications, particularly antipsychotics.
Causes: Prolonged use of dopamine receptor antagonists.
Symptoms: Involuntary movements of the face, tongue, and limbs.
Treatment: Adjustment of medications and use of specific treatments like VMAT2 inhibitors.

Definition: Telangiectasia refers to small dilated blood vessels near the surface of the skin, often appearing as red or blue lines.
Causes: Genetic factors, sun exposure, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Visible red or blue lines on the skin, usually without pain.
Treatment: Laser therapy, sclerotherapy, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Temporal arteritis is an inflammation of the blood vessels, particularly the temporal arteries, which can lead to serious complications.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve autoimmune factors.
Symptoms: Headaches, scalp tenderness, and vision problems.
Treatment: Corticosteroids and monitoring for complications.

Definition: Tendonitis is inflammation of a tendon, often due to overuse or injury.
Causes: Repetitive motion, injury, and aging.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, and stiffness near the affected joint.
Treatment: Rest, ice, physical therapy, and anti-inflammatory medications.

Definition: Tennis elbow is a condition that causes pain on the outer part of the elbow due to overuse of the forearm muscles.
Causes: Repetitive wrist and arm motions.
Symptoms: Pain and tenderness on the outer elbow, weakness in the forearm.
Treatment: Rest, ice, physical therapy, and sometimes corticosteroid injections.

Definition: Testicular cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the testicles.
Causes: Undescended testicle, family history, and certain genetic conditions.
Symptoms: Lump in the testicle, swelling, and pain.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, ultrasound, and blood tests.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy.

Definition: Testicular failure is a condition where the testicles do not produce sufficient testosterone or sperm.
Causes: Genetic disorders, injury, and hormonal imbalances.
Symptoms: Low libido, infertility, and fatigue.
Treatment: Hormone replacement therapy and management of underlying causes.

Definition: Tetanus is a serious bacterial infection that affects the nervous system and causes muscle stiffness.
Causes: Infection with Clostridium tetani bacteria.
Symptoms: Muscle spasms, stiffness, and difficulty swallowing.
Treatment: Antibiotics, tetanus immunoglobulin, and supportive care.

Definition: Thalassemia is a genetic blood disorder characterized by reduced hemoglobin production.
Causes: Genetic mutations affecting hemoglobin production.
Symptoms: Anemia, fatigue, and weakness.
Treatment: Blood transfusions, iron chelation therapy, and sometimes bone marrow transplant.

Definition: A thoracic aortic aneurysm is an abnormal bulge in the wall of the thoracic aorta.
Causes: High blood pressure, atherosclerosis, and genetic conditions.
Symptoms: Chest pain, back pain, and difficulty breathing.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies such as CT or MRI.
Treatment: Monitoring, medications, and surgery in severe cases.

Definition: Thoracic outlet syndrome is a condition caused by compression of the nerves or blood vessels in the thoracic outlet.
Causes: Anatomical abnormalities, trauma, and repetitive activities.
Symptoms: Pain, numbness, and weakness in the arms and hands.
Treatment: Physical therapy, medications, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Throat cancer refers to cancers that develop in the throat (pharynx) or voice box (larynx).
Causes: Smoking, alcohol use, and HPV infection.
Symptoms: Sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and hoarseness.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, biopsy, and clinical evaluation.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy.

Definition: Thrombophlebitis is inflammation of a vein caused by a blood clot.
Causes: Injury, prolonged immobility, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Redness, swelling, and pain along the affected vein.
Treatment: Warm compresses, anti-inflammatory medications, and sometimes anticoagulants.

Definition: Thyroid cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the thyroid gland.
Causes: Genetic factors, radiation exposure, and certain inherited conditions.
Symptoms: Lump in the neck, changes in voice, and difficulty swallowing.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies, blood tests, and biopsy.
Treatment: Surgery, radioactive iodine therapy, and thyroid hormone replacement.

Definition: Thyroid nodules are lumps in the thyroid gland that can be solid or filled with fluid.
Causes: Iodine deficiency, autoimmune diseases, and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic; may include swelling in the neck.
Treatment: Monitoring, surgery, or radioactive iodine therapy if cancerous.

Definition: Thyroiditis is inflammation of the thyroid gland, which can affect hormone production.
Causes: Autoimmune diseases, infections, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Fatigue, weight changes, and neck pain.
Treatment: Hormone replacement therapy and management of symptoms.

Definition: Tinnitus is the perception of noise or ringing in the ears without an external sound source.
Causes: Hearing loss, exposure to loud noises, and ear infections.
Symptoms: Ringing, buzzing, or hissing sounds in the ears.
Treatment: Sound therapy, counseling, and management of underlying conditions.

Definition: Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils, often due to infection.
Causes: Viral or bacterial infections.
Symptoms: Sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and swollen tonsils.
Treatment: Rest, fluids, and antibiotics if bacterial.

Definition: Tourette's syndrome is a neurological disorder characterized by repetitive, involuntary movements and vocalizations.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Tics, which can be motor or vocal.
Treatment: Behavioral therapy, medications, and support.

Definition: Toxic nodular goiter is an enlargement of the thyroid gland with nodules that produce excess thyroid hormones.
Causes: Iodine deficiency and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Weight loss, increased heart rate, and anxiety.
Treatment: Medications, radioactive iodine therapy, and surgery.

Definition: Tricuspid valve regurgitation is a condition where the tricuspid valve does not close properly, allowing blood to flow backward.
Causes: Heart disease, infections, and congenital defects.
Symptoms: Fatigue, swelling in the legs, and palpitations.
Treatment: Medications and surgery in severe cases.

Definition: Trigeminal neuralgia is a chronic pain condition affecting the trigeminal nerve, causing severe facial pain.
Causes: Blood vessel compression of the trigeminal nerve.
Symptoms: Sudden, severe facial pain triggered by touch or movement.
Treatment: Medications, nerve blocks, and surgery.

Definition: Triple-negative breast cancer is a type of breast cancer that does not have three common receptors known to fuel most breast cancer growth.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Lump in the breast, changes in breast shape, and discharge.
Treatment: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and surgery.

Definition: Tuberous sclerosis is a genetic disorder that causes noncancerous tumors to form in many different organs.
Causes: Genetic mutations in TSC1 or TSC2 genes.
Symptoms: Skin lesions, seizures, and developmental delays.
Treatment: Management of symptoms and monitoring for complications.

Definition: Turner syndrome is a genetic condition that affects females, characterized by the absence of all or part of a second sex chromosome.
Causes: Genetic abnormalities affecting the X chromosome.
Symptoms: Short stature, delayed puberty, and heart defects.
Treatment: Hormone therapy and management of associated conditions.

Definition: Type 1 diabetes is a chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
Causes: Autoimmune destruction of insulin-producing beta cells.
Symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, and weight loss.
Treatment: Insulin therapy and blood sugar monitoring.

Definition: Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose).
Causes: Insulin resistance and relative insulin deficiency.
Symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, and fatigue.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, oral medications, and insulin therapy if needed.

Definition: Typhoid fever is a bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi, leading to high fever and gastrointestinal symptoms.
Causes: Contaminated food and water.
Symptoms: High fever, abdominal pain, and diarrhea or constipation.
Treatment: Antibiotics and supportive care.
